atk-s0203a0:98_4: But when a mendicant is walking, standing, sitting, or lying down, it stays on the bank of the Teacher. They walk up and down on the lap, thinking: ‘May they get to see the Teacher; they don’t fall under the sway of slander, or to fill their wrap; and they walk right up and downwards of the Teacher, not to the controlling the Teacher’s tail, or to of the mendicants.
atk-s0203a0:99_0: If a monk acts with the teaching in the Saṅgha, and he doesn’t carefully listen to the teachings; they don’t carefully sit nearby to listen to the teachings; they remember the teachings; they don’t remember the meaning, the teaching, or the Saṅgha. Then he doesn’t repeat what he has said.
atk-s0203a0:9_0: In the same way, this is the a simile of the saw that you demolished a cart, a smeared with poison, or a gum-sher—that’s what we did. But this bad deed they would do now.
atk-s0203a0:9_1: It’s just because of the three feelings in the four oceans, to the fact that they’ve been worn away and eroded, so that this much suffering will have been worn away and eroded by it. That’s the wrong time for them to know.’
atk-s0203a0:9_2: Another time will give up undeveloped in the present life, the wrong time to give up unskillful qualities and embracing skillful qualities.
atk-s0203a0:9_3: That’s how it was the same thing.
